meanings.definition: A type of plant native to New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: The catlins in the garden bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent2: I learned about different types of catlins in my botany class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide its acorn in the catlins.
meanings.sent4: Her love for gardening was as vibrant as the colors of the catlins.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the catlins filled the air with a sweet scent.

meanings.sent1: Mr. Catlins greeted us warmly at the family reunion.
meanings.sent2: The Catlins family has a long history in this town.
meanings.sent3: When asked about his last name, John joked that he was 'the king of the Catlins.'
meanings.sent4: The Catlins surname echoed through the halls of the old mansion.
meanings.sent5: The Catlins family crest proudly displayed their heritage.

meanings.definition: A geographical region in New Zealand.
meanings.sent1: We planned a trip to explore the beauty of the Catlins.
meanings.sent2: The Catlins offer stunning views of nature and wildlife.
meanings.sent3: During our hike in the Catlins, we stumbled upon a hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent4: The Catlins stood like a guardian at the edge of the country.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted the sky above the Catlins in shades of pink and orange.
